page.title: 10Landscape west: FINTRY
page.content: This area consists of rocks of the {Old Red Sandstone Age}and in parts of the{Calciferous Sandstone Series.}They are generally soft and composed of sandstone, shale, and limestone. Thus the landscape is rolling with{boulder {clay}deposits forming excellent examples of{drumlins. { {The dominant landscape feature is the {River Endrick.}It flows through the middle of the area east to west, in large meanders. The wide flood plain, made of alluvium, has good examples of river terraces. This part of the valley often floods and so land near the river usually has permanent grass. Several of the tributary streams, like Ballikinrain Burn, have carved quite dramatic and steep sided glens.
